techmeme.title: Sources: 1H 2025 iPhone shipments to decline ~6%, annual shipments to remain flat at around 220M to 225M units; ultra-thin iPhone's thinnest part will be ~5.5mm (Ming-Chi Kuo)
OpenAI's crawlers took down e-commerce site Triplegangers by relentlessly trying to scrape the entire site, whose robots.txt file was not properly configured (Julie Bort/TechCrunch)
Sources: TSMC cuts ties with Singapore-based PowerAIR due to a potential breach of US export controls, after a TSMC chip was found in a Huawei AI processor (Che Pan/South China Morning Post)
Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo says TSMC has begun producing advanced 4nm chips "on par in yield and quality with Taiwan" for US customers in Phoenix, Arizona (David Shepardson/Reuters)
Sources: Foxconn stops sending Chinese employees to iPhone factories in India and recalls already stationed staff, while China stalls equipment shipments (Rest of World)
